content.label: Have all push notifications turned off, yet day after day, keep getting push notifications
I’ve used this app in California, Missouri and now Italy!  I am so impressed at how many trails I have been able to find all over!

I use this for finding running trails and hiking. I love challenging trail runs so I can filter by minimum elevation change and length to find locations that fit my preferences. Plenty of other features too.

Great app on iPhone like many of the features.
When you start a hike and use Apple Watch Ultra to track the map is all over the place and not showing the hiking trail and your location accurately… note iPhone is near by as well. 
Tested by launching the maps app or google maps on the Apple Watch they both show the right location… meaning that this is a all trials issue. 

Otherwise great app (using the subscription)
The iPad is now 14 years old. This app is still not made for iPad. It’s disgraceful.

title.label: Stop posting routes to sacred sites

content.label: Ever since the influencer community has started visiting places for clout, the places they visit have been trashed. Many of these places are sacred sites and won’t be around for future generations if All Trails doesn’t start moderating what people make public here. Leave places better than you found them, not worse.
I love how easy it is to track an all the info it provides
Great app

The map feature is very frustrating, every time I look up a specific trail it brings up that page then when I click on the map to show where it is I can’t see any other trails surrounding it therefore I have to look up the town the trail is in find the pin and then I can look at the trails around it but every time I click on a pin it resets the map so I have to find the trail again. This is very poor design, I don’t use this app very much and I’ve already spotted a inconvenient flaw please fix this thank you very much.
It’s easy to use and great for finding the best hikes in any area. The reviews of the users are very helpful. I like being able to download the maps and track your location.

I am not surprised to see this app is a highly rated one with no negatives to boot. 
Over the years I inadvertently had created a few accounts with different sign-ins as I had forgotten the previous one’s credentials. 
I had pretty much given up on trying  to remember them all and decided to contact the “dreaded support link” feature. I didn’t think I’d get resolution because of other app customer service. Well I was very wrong. I was contacted within a few hours and with some quick back and forth emails I was back connected! It didn’t stop there and this very nice CSR saw my other errant accounts and to my continued surprise, merged them for me. I can’t say enough how greatful to have this kingd of support. Now I can see my data in one spot
AllTrails is the best! 
Well worth the subscription fee.

This app is great pretty much all around the US. Has great trail coverage. Home time estimates are usually a little inaccurate for me (always an hour or so longer than it actually takes me) but besides that no other complaints!

title.label: So much fun and such a meme

content.label: I always miss a turn. I’m not friend that says let’s go on a 5 mile hike and it turns out to be 8 miles. Thank you for making it reality. I wouldn’t have gone on those trails if I didn’t know where they started!

title.label: Pay barrier to the great outdoors

content.label: Information regarding trails on public land should be free to all users. Why should the safety of a downloaded map when hiking on tax payer funded lands be something we have to pay for. There maps should be free use; unless the app users actually created the map from scratch, forging thru the lands themselves to discover the terrain. If not, they are making money off of other people’s work. They do not offer a low income discount. I’m grossed out. Pay to play for the great outdoors! America!

I’ve been using this app for such a long time and it’s normally a great tool to find hikes. I no longer am able to see all the different trails and am only shown a very select few options that are within my town. That’s not what I want this app for, I want to find trails that I’ve never been on and hike in new areas. Now I’m no longer able to do so because it wants to charge $35.99 a year for the access to all the different trails. I’m highly disappointed that this app has taken away the accessibility to find trails in new areas, and instead has become just another way for developers to get money.

Probably one of my most used apps as a trail runner, been using it since 2017. 

Unfortunately one of my favorite features, filtering nearby trails, seems to have disappeared. It’s extremely frustrating as this was easily the top feature of this app and now only available through a desktop. It was a great way to plan your routes but now you just have to either use a computer or guess.

As a now paying member, the only benefit is downloading a map if you’re deep in the trail somewhere. The weather features and all that can be found through other free maps. 

It would be amazing to get this feature back and be able to add multiple segments as a planned route into it as well.
Best trail app hands down … thanks for the free version
Love this app no matter where you are or want to go you can find it here!  Love the hidden gems I may not have discovered on my own.
Fairly decent for simple navigation, but the map quality is poor in detail.  Its also kind of confusing to use.

title.label: Good for ideas, but not accurate

content.label: It’s a good starting point for finding a trail that maybe there. The mileage and intensity are comically incorrect. People’s reviews of the trails are more accurate than the app.

Would be better if it supported family sharing for this app

We need more trails on here for the Wichita mountains!!

title.label: Great app for us nature lovers!

content.label: If you get the premium upgrade I promise you'll benefit every way possible! This is a great guide whenever im on vacation or simply want a change of scenery!
Charged me $35 for a subscription after I cancelled my free trial and they refuse to refund it.

When I signed up for a seven day “free trial” to get access to more features I was charged immediately instead getting the seven free days to try it.  As soon as I got email saying I was charged I cancelled but AllTrails said they could not refund me and i needed to do that through Apple. Waiting to hear back from Apple, but AllTrails was responsible for the mistake/deception.
Great app and info regarding all trails

This app used to be amazing. Now I can’t tap somewhere without it asking for money. 

Really sad state of things. Can’t even sort by distance without paying

It takes two steps.

When you used the app to delete your account, you’ll get a pop confirming account deleted. But, you will continue to be billed unless you also reply to an email that the account deleted message does not warn you is part two of the process.

title.label: Use this app all the time

content.label: The capability to track you as you move along what the app has marked as a trail is often helpful, since urban trails, in particular, can be a jumble of trail fragments. The app displays elevation changes tied to each spot along the trail. That, also, is occasionally helpful. Coverage outside the U.S. varies, but I have used it to my benefit when hiking in western Europe. I find the interface a little difficult, and purchasers get more often than I would like come-ons to purchase merchandise. Still, I’m likely to continue subscribing, yearly, as long as I am able to hike.
AllTrails is the best app for finding trails for the young and old! The trails are easy to navigate and follow! I love to contribute with my pictures and my other contributions!
Super helpful to make sure you stay on the trail and can read threw the reviews of each trail and find exactly what your looking for!

I love being able to find trails wherever I am and wherever I plan to be! It’s easy to find trails that fit my timeline, my scenic desires, and to be able to download trail maps for use offline. Really crucial in the PNW and Northwest, where cell reception can be spotty.
I really like AllTrails I just wish it didn’t grossly overcalculate my milage.
Always loved this app until they did the last update.  The most aggravating side is the delay for the trails to show in the app.  Have waited a minute or more for trails to appear.
Great feedback from other hikers
Sometimes it spontaneously ends hikes while navigating. Not an issue now that I’m sporting a Garmin though.

I have the pro version and it’s 100% worth the investment. This has ALWAYS been my favorite hiking/biking app. But it has been a little glitchy lately and not tracked me or ran my LifeLine correctly. I’m hoping that’s resolved soon because this has been my go-to hiking companion for years upon years now.

I use this app for cycling. Trail riding, to be specific.
When I’m on a trail I have to constantly shift the map to follow the route. If I “re-center” the map it gives me a 10,000 foot view and I have no idea where I’m going.
Please include an option to zoom in on my position icon while centered for MTB use.

title.label: The latest version is from bad to worse

content.label: You can’t even search your own map (My Maps). Please put it back.

It was love at first hike with this app. I’ve had it for about 5 years. I got a really good deal with the sub the first year. It was such a delight to use that I’ve kept it and happily pay full price for it ever since. The features I really need/use are included in the free version but it’s so great I want to support the app with paying for the subscription. On top of that, the customer service has been EXCELLENT! I’m so impressed. I have only reached out a few times and they have been lightning quick at replying AND resolving my issues.

title.label: The hiking app we all needed

content.label: I was hoping an app like this existed and AllTrails is it! You can filter for walks/hikes - filters include paved (for strollers etc), dog friendly, distance, etc. app is super easy to use and you can track trails you are currently hiking through the app. I am so thankful this app exists!

title.label: Was great, now you have to pay to use.

content.label: I absolutely loved this app and used it all the time. I just moved back to my home state and was trying to find new places to go on walks with my kids. In order to use any of the filters, map, distance, any option other than close to your current location, you’re required to pay. Super disappointed.

Great app! I love being able to read reviews from other hikers so I can prepare adequately. It’s surprising how many trails this app has! Even in places where I think no one would have visited, the app has trails. Highly recommend for any outdoorsy folks. Go get out in nature, take your shoes off, and experience this world that the Lord has made for us. The beauties of this life are up to you to discover !
Wonderful maps and lets you build you own

We have been using AllTrails for about 18 months and it is flawless and the best thing I can say about it aside from the obvious, is the first time you go off trail by accident - It pays for itself and there are always new features being added, and updated. It is the Primo for hikers.
They charged me twice and they refuse to refund one of the charges. I have emailed 4 times requesting a refund.

It’s good for seeing mapped trails and following them. Intuitive controls. A few glitches, but the laughable aspect is cost. For premium version (as of this review) is $34.99 PER YEAR! I don’t think so. No app will ever benefit from recurring charges. I would have been willing for my use to pay this one time, but never yearly. There are to many other tracking apps in the store to pay this for “AllTrails ” there is no outstanding feature in this app to warrant that cost.
This is the best show app ever love it
Epic App!!!
I love this app. I just download a map prior to leaving my house. It has never led me astray. I love the wrong trail alert. It gives you also.

Loved the app. Missed a confusing corner on the trail and realized we were off track. Looked at All Trails app which showed we were off the trail. Back tracked and with app open got back on the trail.
